Description:
NotSerializableException when stop the server where BIRT web project ran on.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a BIRT wtp project, right click, select Run As->Run on Server.
2. Choose Tomcat5.5.7 as server, click Next.
3. Add the project as configured project, click Finish.
4. Click View Example in opened BIRT welcome jsp page.
5. Select the server in Server viewer and right click, select stop.

Expected result:
Server stops without errors.

Actual result:
Server stopped but threw exception.

Error logs:
警告: Cannot serialize session attribute tasks for session 88AB29AD238E62036202BE45B4BC975E
java.io.NotSerializableException: org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.impl.RenderTask
	at java.io.ObjectOutputStream.writeObject0(ObjectOutputStream.java:1075)

Engine task class doesn't implement Serializable interface. When web server try to serialize session object, throw this exception.
Maybe engine needs to support serialization for some classes. Assign engine to investigate.
Has removed engine task from http session when done.

EngineTask doesn?t support serializable, so it should not be labeled serializable.

Viewer should remove all none-serializable objects from the http session. Viewer also could label some object in session as no-persistence, so it won't be serailized into disk.

If viewer got an NotSerializableException of EngineTask, viewer should removed EngineTask from http session, then ignore the exception.
Because engine task can?t support serializable interface now, encapsulate engine task into a new class and avoid serializing engine task when session canceled.
